title: Automated and Configurable Programming Project Checking with Chasten
section: The Problem with Traditional Static Analysis
text:
The Problem with Traditional Static Analysis
Regular expression (regex) ‚â† code understanding

Fails on structural nuance
Hard to maintain across formatting/styles

title: Automated and Configurable Programming Project Checking with Chasten
section: The Problem with Traditional Static Analysis
text:
The Problem with Traditional Static Analysis
AST tools are powerful but complex

Require managing node types
Difficult to prototype new rules

title: Automated and Configurable Programming Project Checking with Chasten
text:
Chasten
A Python program that uses XPATH expressions to find patterns in the abstract syntax tree (AST) of a Python program

title: Automated and Configurable Programming Project Checking with Chasten
text:
What is an AST?
Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) = structured representation of code
x = 1 + 2
Assign
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Name(x)
 ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ BinOp(+)
      ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Constant(1)
      ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Constant(2)

title: Automated and Configurable Programming Project Checking with Chasten
text:
Why XPATH?

‚úÖ Perfect for navigating ASTs
‚úÖ Easy to write and understand

/FunctionDef/body//If[ancestor::If and not(parent::orelse)]
‚Äì> Matches function with double nested if

title: Automated and Configurable Programming Project Checking with Chasten
text:
Features

‚ú® Easy-to-configure, automated analysis of a Python program‚Äôs abstract syntax tree
üìÉ Flexible and easy-to-use YAML-based configuration file for describing analyses and checks
üöÄ Configurable saving of analysis results in the JSON, CSV, or SQLite formats
üåÑ Interactive results analysis through the use of a locally running datasette server

title: Automated and Configurable Programming Project Checking with Chasten
text: Chasten Workflow

title: Automated and Configurable Programming Project Checking with Chasten
text:
Key Takeaways

‚úÖ Declarative rule-writing with XPath
Easily define grading criteria and static analysis checks ‚Äî no need to write Python plugins.
üß† Teachable insights into code structure
Helps students understand Abstract Syntax Trees (ASTs) and how code is interpreted structurally.
üìä Structured, explorable outputs
Export results to SQLite and use Datasette to visualize errors, coverage, and student patterns.
üß™ Supports research and pedagogy
Useful for analyzing coding behavior at scale, detecting common anti-patterns in student code.
üìö Integrates into grading pipelines
Run Chasten on student submissions to check for required docstrings, type hints, nested logic, etc.

title: Conference Presentations
text:
Welcome to our collection of conference presentations focusing on educational technology and development tools. These presentations cover various aspects of modern software development, automated testing, and educational technology implementation.



Automated and Configurable Programming Project Checking with Chasten

Learn about automated project checking and configuration
Understand how to implement efficient project validation
Explore best practices for automated testing

Up and Running with GitHub, GitHub Classroom, and GitHub Actions

Master GitHub workflow integration
Set up GitHub Classroom for educational purposes
Implement automated workflows with GitHub Actions

ExecExam: A Tool to Facilitate Effective Executable Examinations in Python

Discover tools for creating executable examinations
Learn about Python-based testing frameworks
Implement effective examination strategies

Building and Deploying Course Websites with Python, Quarto, and Mkdocs

Create modern course websites
Implement documentation with Mkdocs
Deploy and maintain educational content





Each presentation is available in the slides section. You can navigate through the presentations using the navigation menu above. Each presentation includes:

Detailed slides with code examples
Implementation guides
Best practices and recommendations
Additional resources and references




These presentations are open source and available for educational purposes. Feel free to use and modify them according to your needs. If you find any issues or have suggestions for improvements, please contribute through our GitHub repository.
